Messages For You logo: speaker icon **We’re here to help.** If you have trouble paying your bill, a few minutes is all it takes to set up a payment plan. *Need a few more days to pay your bill? No problem.* Visit conEd.com/PaymentPlans to schedule an extension, enroll in a payment agreement and manage your energy bill online. logo: Supply costs are higher for electric and gas this winter. Weather and increased energy usage can also impact your bill. Visit conEd.com/UnderstandYourRate to learn about rising energy costs and how to manage your bill. Summary : This image displays a payment status panel showing the current balance due and the scheduled direct pay date. graphic panel: Main Content : • Left section: "Current balance due $44.89" in large, bold white text on a blue background. • Right section: "Direct Pay 04/07/23" in smaller, bold white text on a slightly darker blue background. Layout : • Two adjacent rectangular sections, separated by a thin vertical line. • Left section is larger and contains the balance amount; right section contains the payment method and date. Text Details : • "Current balance due" appears above the amount "$44.89". • "Direct Pay" appears above the date "04/07/23". Colour Scheme : • Both sections use shades of blue for background, with white text for high contrast. • No additional icons, graphics, or interactive elements are present. Analysis : • The panel clearly communicates a financial obligation ($44.89) and the scheduled payment date (April 7, 2023) via direct pay, using a simple and visually distinct layout for clarity. Summary : This figure presents the average daily electric usage (in kWh) for a service address over a one-year period, alongside average daily temperature, to illustrate seasonal trends in electricity consumption. bar and line chart: # Title & Axes : • Title: "Your average daily electric usage" • Y-axis (left): kWh (electric usage), tick labels at 3.75, 7.5, 11.25, 15 • Y-axis (right): temp* (temperature), tick labels at 0, 25, 50, 75, 100 • X-axis: Months from Mar to Mar (13 months: Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar) # Data Points : • Average daily electric usage (bar chart, blue bars): – Mar: low – Apr: low – May: moderate – Jun: moderate-high – Jul: high – Aug: peak (highest) – Sep: high – Oct: moderate – Nov: low – Dec: low – Jan: low – Feb: low – Mar: low • Average daily temperature (line chart, orange line): – Rises from Mar, peaks in Jul–Aug, then declines through winter, lowest in Dec–Jan, rises again by Mar # Design Encodings : • Electric usage: blue vertical bars • Temperature: orange line with black dots for each month • Dual y-axes: left for kWh, right for temperature • Background highlight for "2.87 kWh" (average daily usage) • Title and section header in white text on teal background # Distribution & Trends : • Electric usage is lowest in winter months (Nov–Mar), rises in spring, peaks in summer (Aug), then declines. • Temperature follows a similar pattern, peaking in summer and lowest in winter. # Analysis : • There is a clear seasonal correlation: electric usage increases as temperature rises, peaking in the hottest months (likely due to cooling needs), and drops during cooler months. • The average daily electric usage for the period is 2.87 kWh. • Both electric usage and temperature show a single annual peak in summer and a trough in winter. Questions? Contact Us: logo: computer monitor icon conEd.com/ContactUs logo: phone receiver icon 1-212-243-1900 or 1-800-752-6633 Account number: 44-6011-0985-0021-7 Direct Pay: $44.89 04/07/23 logo: conEdison PO Box 1702 New York, NY 10116-1702 # Your Energy Bill The amount of $44.89 will be automatically deducted from your bank on Apr 7, 2023. MITCHELL JOHNSON 435 W 57 ST 2H NEW YORK NY 10019-1723 Direct Payment Plan Do not mail a payment + M97 0020 446011098500217 100000004489 100000004489 0014317 Summary : This image shows a barcode consisting of a series of vertical black and white bars of varying widths, with no visible numeric or alphanumeric string beneath the bars. barcode: Barcode Details : • No human-readable numeric or alphanumeric string is visible below or above the bars. • Barcode type is not explicitly indicated; the format resembles a generic 1D barcode (e.g., Code 128 or similar), but the exact type cannot be determined from the image alone. • The barcode contains approximately 44 modules (bars and spaces). • Quiet zones (blank space) are present on both the left and right sides of the barcode. • The barcode is horizontally oriented and centered on a white background. • No additional text, logo, or annotation is present. Dimensions & Placement : • The barcode is a narrow horizontal strip, with a height much smaller than its width. • No scale or measurement units are provided. Analysis : • The barcode is machine-readable and intended for automated scanning, but without a visible string or context, its encoded data cannot be determined from the image alone. • The absence of a numeric/alphanumeric string suggests it may be a stylized or sample barcode rather than one used for retail or inventory purposes. Name: MITCHELL JOHNSON Account number: 44-6011-0985-0021-7 Page 2 of 2 Your electricity breakdown Rate: EL1 Residential or Religious Electric Meter Detail – billing period from Feb 24, 2023 to Mar 27, 2023 (31 days)

0136419245047ActualMar 27, 234958ActualFeb 24, 238989 kWh
# Your Supply Charges Supply 89 kWh @11.1124¢/kWh $9.89 Merchant function charge $0.43 GRT & other tax surcharges $0.25 Total electricity supply charges: $10.57 Your total electricity supply cost for this bill is 11.9¢ per kWh. You can compare this price with those offered by energy services companies (ESCOs). For a list of ESCOs, visit PowerYourWay.com or call 1-800-780-2884. Your Delivery Charges
Basic service charge$18.85
Delivery 89 kWh @12.9888¢/kWh$11.56
System Benefit Charge @0.5169¢/kWh$0.46
GRT & other tax surcharges$1.52
Total electricity delivery charges$32.39
Sales tax @4.5000%$1.93
Total sales tax$1.93
Your electricity total$44.89
# Understanding your bill Basic service charge (Electric): Charge for basic system infrastructure and customer-related services, including customer accounting, and metering services. A billing and payment processing charge of $1.28, *which may be avoided by switching to an energy services company (ESCO)*, is also included. Billing charges: These charges are for the electricity you need (supply) and getting the electricity to you (delivery). Rates are based on a 30 day period. When your billing period is more or less than 30 days, we prorate your bill accordingly. Delivery: Charge for maintaining the system through which Con Edison delivers electricity to you. Electricity Supply: Charge for the electricity supplied to you by Con Edison. GRT & other tax surcharges: Taxes on Con Edison gross receipts from sales of utility services and other tax surcharges. Merchant Function Charge (Electric): Charge associated with procuring electricity, credit and collection related activities and uncollectible accounts. Sales tax: Tax collected on behalf of New York City. System Benefit Charge (Electric): The System Benefits Charge recovers costs associated with clean energy activities conducted by the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority (NYSERDA) and energy efficiency programs implemented by the Company. Temperature Data* Source: Central Park Weather station logo: megaphone icon **Get Smarter with your smart meter.** Learn how much energy you are using, and how to avoid seasonal spikes in energy use. Log in or create an account at conEd.com/EnergyUsage. logo: stylized "si" **Looking for LED light bulbs or a new thermostat?** Con Edison residential customers are eligible for instant rebates and additional savings on energy-efficient equipment from top brands. Shop the Con Edison Marketplace at: **marketplace.conEd.com**. logo: stylized green "si" with sound waves We have 662-231-8098 as your primary phone number and MDJOHNSONDAWGS@GMAIL.COM as your email address. Need to update? Please go to conEd.com or call us. ⓘ How to get in touch with us Email or chat: conEd.com/ContactUs **Phone:** 1-800-752-6633 **Mail:** Con Edison, PO Box 138, New York, NY 10276-0138 # Ways to pay your bill 1. **Auto Pay:** Pay your bill automatically from your checking or savings account at no charge. Enroll at conEd.com/MyAccount or call 1-212-243-1900. 2. **Online:** Pay at conEd.com/MyAccount using your bank account, credit card or debit card at no charge. 3. **App:** Download the Con Edison app from the App Store or Google Play Store. 4. **Phone:** Pay by phone at 1-888-925-5016 using your bank account, credit card or debit card at no charge. 5. **In Person:** Our walk-in centers are open Monday through Friday from 8.30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Bronx: 1775 Grand Concourse Brooklyn: 345 Jay Street Manhattan: 122 East 124th Street Queens: 89-67 162nd Street Staten Island: 1140 Richmond Terrace Westchester: 1 Bogopa Plaza 6. **Mail:** Send a check or money order, payable to Con Edison, using the envelope provided to authorize us to make a one-time electronic fund transfer from your account or to process the payment as a check. You will not get the check back. Do not send cash. Con Edison PO Box 1702 New York, NY 10116-1702 Summary : This image displays the Con Edison logo alongside a promotional message encouraging customers to pay their bills online, with a specific URL provided. logo: Con Edison (ConEd) with tagline and URL Logo Design : • Blue rounded square containing a stylized white "C" formed by three horizontal lines and a curved vertical line. • Logo is positioned to the left of the text. Text Elements : • Bold tagline: "Save a stamp. Pay your bill online at" • URL in blue: "ConEd.com/MyAccount" Layout : • Logo on the left, text on the right in two lines. • URL is highlighted in blue for emphasis. Analysis : • The logo and message promote digital bill payment, emphasizing convenience and cost savings (no need for a stamp). • Blue colour in both logo and URL reinforces brand identity and draws attention to the online payment option. Summary : This image is a promotional notice encouraging users to go paperless by enrolling in eBill, featuring a QR code and a web address for enrollment. logo: Con Edison "Go Paperless!" eBill enrollment notice QR Code & Text : • A blue-and-white QR code is displayed on the left side. • To the right, bold blue text reads: "Go Paperless!" • Black text below instructs: "Scan the QR Code with your smart device or visit conEd.com/MyAccount to enroll in eBill". Design & Layout : • QR code is square, approximately the height of two lines of text. • Text is left-aligned, with the blue headline above the black instructional text. • The web address is in bold for emphasis. Analysis : • The QR code and web link provide two options for users to access the eBill enrollment page, promoting digital billing and reducing paper use. • The use of blue and black text draws attention to the call to action and instructions. **Questions?** Call toll free 1-800-75-CONED (1-800-752-6633)

logo: speaker icon
**We’re here to help.** If you have trouble paying your bill, a few minutes is all it takes to set up a payment plan. *Need a few more days to pay your bill? No problem.* Visit conEd.com/PaymentPlans to schedule an extension, enroll in a payment agreement and manage your energy bill online.

Summary : This image displays a payment status panel showing the current balance due and the scheduled direct pay date.

graphic panel:
  Main Content :
    • Left section: "Current balance due $44.89" in large, bold white text on a blue background.
    • Right section: "Direct Pay 04/07/23" in smaller, bold white text on a slightly darker blue background.
  Layout :
    • Two adjacent rectangular sections, separated by a thin vertical line.
    • Left section is larger and contains the balance amount; right section contains the payment method and date.
  Text Details :
    • "Current balance due" appears above the amount "$44.89".
    • "Direct Pay" appears above the date "04/07/23".
  Colour Scheme :

Summary : This figure presents the average daily electric usage (in kWh) for a service address over a one-year period, alongside average daily temperature, to illustrate seasonal trends in electricity consumption.

bar and line chart:
# Title & Axes :
   • Title: "Your average daily electric usage"
   • Y-axis (left): kWh (electric usage), tick labels at 3.75, 7.5, 11.25, 15
   • Y-axis (right): temp* (temperature), tick labels at 0, 25, 50, 75, 100
   • X-axis: Months from Mar to Mar (13 months: Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec, Jan, Feb, Mar)

# Data Points :
   • Average daily electric usage (bar chart, blue bars):
     – Mar: low
     – Apr: low
     – May: moderate
     – Jun: moderate-high
     – Jul: high
     – Aug: peak (highest)
     – Sep: high
     – Oct: moderate
     – Nov: low
     – Dec: low
     – Jan: low
     – Feb: low
     – Mar: low
   • Average daily temperature (line chart, orange line):
     – Rises from Mar, peaks in Jul–Aug, then declines through winter, lowest in Dec–Jan, rises again by Mar

# Design Encodings :
   • Electric usage: blue vertical bars
   • Temperature: orange line with black dots for each month
   • Dual y-axes: left for kWh, right for temperature
   • Background highlight for "2.87 kWh" (average daily usage)
   • Title and section header in white text on teal background

# Distribution & Trends :
   • Electric usage is lowest in winter months (Nov–Mar), rises in spring, peaks in summer (Aug), then declines.
   • Temperature follows a similar pattern, peaking in summer and lowest in winter.

# Analysis :
   • There is a clear seasonal correlation: electric usage increases as temperature rises, peaking in the hottest months (likely due to cooling needs), and drops during cooler months.
   • The average daily electric usage for the period is 2.87 kWh.
   • Both electric usage and temperature show a single annual peak in summer and a trough in winter.
Questions? Contact Us: logo: computer monitor icon conEd.com/ContactUs logo: phone receiver icon 1-212-243-1900 or 1-800-752-6633

# Your Supply Charges
Supply 89 kWh @11.1124¢/kWh                $9.89
Merchant function charge                    $0.43
GRT & other tax surcharges                  $0.25

Total electricity supply charges: $10.57

Your total electricity supply cost for this bill is 11.9¢ per kWh.  You can compare this price with those offered by energy services companies (ESCOs).  For a list of ESCOs, visit PowerYourWay.com or call 1-800-780-2884.

Your Delivery Charges
Basic service charge$18.85
Delivery 89 kWh @12.9888¢/kWh$11.56
System Benefit Charge @0.5169¢/kWh$0.46
GRT & other tax surcharges$1.52
Total electricity delivery charges$32.39
Sales tax @4.5000%$1.93
Total sales tax$1.93
Your electricity total$44.89

# Understanding your bill

Basic service charge (Electric): Charge for basic system infrastructure and customer-related services, including customer accounting, and metering services.  A billing and payment processing charge of $1.28, *which may be avoided by switching to an energy services company (ESCO)*, is also included.
Billing charges: These charges are for the electricity you need (supply) and getting the electricity to you (delivery). Rates are based on a 30 day period. When your billing period is more or less than 30 days, we prorate your bill accordingly.
Delivery: Charge for maintaining the system through which Con Edison delivers electricity to you.
Electricity Supply: Charge for the electricity supplied to you by Con Edison.
GRT & other tax surcharges: Taxes on Con Edison gross receipts from sales of utility services and other tax surcharges.
Merchant Function Charge (Electric): Charge associated with procuring electricity, credit and collection related activities and uncollectible accounts.
Sales tax: Tax collected on behalf of New York City.
System Benefit Charge (Electric): The System Benefits Charge recovers costs associated with clean energy activities conducted by the New York State Energy Research and Development Authority (NYSERDA) and energy efficiency programs implemented by the Company.
Temperature Data* Source: Central Park Weather station

logo: megaphone icon
**Get Smarter with your smart meter.**
Learn how much energy you are using, and how to avoid seasonal spikes in energy use. Log in or create an account at conEd.com/EnergyUsage.

logo: stylized "si"

**Looking for LED light bulbs or a new thermostat?** Con Edison residential customers are eligible for instant rebates and additional savings on energy-efficient equipment from top brands. Shop the Con Edison Marketplace at:  **marketplace.conEd.com**.

logo: stylized green "si" with sound waves
We have 662-231-8098 as your primary phone number and MDJOHNSONDAWGS@GMAIL.COM as your email address. Need to update? Please go to conEd.com or call us.
ⓘ How to get in touch with us
Email or chat: conEd.com/ContactUs
**Mail:** Con Edison, PO Box 138, New York, NY 10276-0138

# Ways to pay your bill

1. **Auto Pay:** Pay your bill automatically from your checking or savings account at no charge. Enroll at conEd.com/MyAccount or call 1-212-243-1900.
2. **Online:** Pay at conEd.com/MyAccount using your bank account, credit card or debit card at no charge.
3. **App:** Download the Con Edison app from the App Store or Google Play Store.
4. **Phone:** Pay by phone at 1-888-925-5016 using your bank account, credit card or debit card at no charge.
5. **In Person:** Our walk-in centers are open Monday through Friday from 8.30 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Bronx: 1775 Grand Concourse  
Brooklyn: 345 Jay Street  
Manhattan: 122 East 124th Street  
Queens: 89-67 162nd Street  
Staten Island: 1140 Richmond Terrace  
Westchester: 1 Bogopa Plaza

6.  **Mail:** Send a check or money order, payable to Con Edison, using the envelope provided to authorize us to make a one-time electronic fund transfer from your account or to process the payment as a check. You will not get the check back. Do not send cash.
    Con Edison
    PO Box 1702
    New York, NY 10116-1702

Summary : This image displays the Con Edison logo alongside a promotional message encouraging customers to pay their bills online, with a specific URL provided.

logo: Con Edison (ConEd) with tagline and URL

Logo Design :
  • Blue rounded square containing a stylized white "C" formed by three horizontal lines and a curved vertical line.
  • Logo is positioned to the left of the text.

Text Elements :
  • Bold tagline: "Save a stamp. Pay your bill online at"
  • URL in blue: "ConEd.com/MyAccount"

Layout :
  • Logo on the left, text on the right in two lines.
  • URL is highlighted in blue for emphasis.

Analysis :
  • The logo and message promote digital bill payment, emphasizing convenience and cost savings (no need for a stamp).
  • Blue colour in both logo and URL reinforces brand identity and draws attention to the online payment option.

Summary : This image is a promotional notice encouraging users to go paperless by enrolling in eBill, featuring a QR code and a web address for enrollment.

logo: Con Edison "Go Paperless!" eBill enrollment notice

QR Code & Text : 
  • A blue-and-white QR code is displayed on the left side.
  • To the right, bold blue text reads: "Go Paperless!"
  • Black text below instructs: "Scan the QR Code with your smart device or visit conEd.com/MyAccount to enroll in eBill".

Design & Layout : 
  • QR code is square, approximately the height of two lines of text.
  • Text is left-aligned, with the blue headline above the black instructional text.
  • The web address is in bold for emphasis.

Analysis : 
  • The QR code and web link provide two options for users to access the eBill enrollment page, promoting digital billing and reducing paper use.
  • The use of blue and black text draws attention to the call to action and instructions.
**Questions?** Call toll free 1-800-75-CONED (1-800-752-6633)
